text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I wanted to share

with you my recipe for strawberry shortcake
cupcakes, now if you've been following me

for a long time then you'll know, every year
the first week of May we go to a strawberry

festival in Pennsylvania and the thing I look
forward to more than any other treat is the
strawberry shortcake.

It's delicious and I have made a strawberry
shortcake recipe before but I figured, let's

make a cupcake version of it because it's
really pretty yo look at, perfect for spring

perfect for entertaining and great for Mother's
Day.

If you're looking for something to make for
your mom or for yourself or for your family.

This one's really pretty and it's got a really
great flavor then these are it.

Let me take you over the ingredients so we
can get this thing started.

You'll need some all purpose flower, baking
powder and salt, granulated sugar, I've got

eggs, some orange zest and orange juice, unsalted
butter that's been softened at room temperature,

little bit of milk, I've got some vanilla
paste, some fresh chopped strawberries, additional

little bit of orange zest some corn starch,
sugar and orange juice.

Now these four ingredients back here, or five
technically, those are going to be for a really

lovely like strawberry compote we are gonna
put in the middle of these cupcakes because

instead of putting jam, the thing I love personally
about strawberry shortcake is that it's got

real strawberries in it so I wanted to make
up my own version of that and then I'm gonna

stick them in the middle of the cupcakes and
it'll be divine.

The first thing you wanna do is get your oven
preheated to 350, what I have here is my muffin

tin that's non stick that I've sprayed with
non stick spray.

You can put liners in here if yours is not
non-stick, I'm not gonna put liners in here

today because I don't want them to ruin the
presentation and if I spray it really well,

they'll come out beautifully so I'm not worried
about that at all.
Ok, let's get started.

The first thing I'm gonna do, I'm gonna cream
together my butter and sugar and I'm doing
it in my big standing mixer.
As always.

that I'll show you in a different recipe,
a different episode.

But for me, strawberry shortcake is a classic
like vanilla scone or pound cake depending

on where you get it, and then you've got your
strawberry mixture and whipped cream.

that's my favorite strawberry shortcake.
So, it's gonna be a good one!

Gonna add my eggs and some vanilla paste,

I am going to just use my ice cream scoop
